intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: Perhaps we should rest, milady. Master Saleh, is it much farther?

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: We’re close. It’s only half a day ahead.

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: I would ask for a moment’s rest before continuing. We are all exhausted. We can go no farther today.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: No, Seth. I’ll be fine. We must not be delayed by my weakness.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Whew... Hah... I didn’t realize we’d be climbing so high.

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: ...As I warned you before we set out, the footing here can be treacherous.

intro.speaker: Innes
intro.line: Do you people truly live in this place? These barren crags seem unfit for human habitation...

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: Material wealth brings strife. We’ve no need of these things. In this, we are of one mind with the Great Dragon.

intro.speaker: Eirika
intro.line: More monsters... Master Saleh, do these creatures normally inhabit this region?

intro.speaker: Saleh
intro.line: No... Those things come from Darkling Woods. It’s been a long time since they’ve wandered this far afield. It’s as the elder says... Evil omens take many shapes.

intro.speaker: L’Arachel
intro.line: It looks like those fiends have noticed us as well. We should move, Eirika.

battle.speaker: Saleh
battle.line: I’m concerned for Ewan as well. I’ll go with you. I hope he is safe.

battle.speaker: Ewan
battle.line: Hey! Wa-wait a moment. We can work this out... You, uh, aren’t interested in talking, are you? Aaaaaa...

battle.speaker: Ewan
battle.line: Where’d all those freaks come from? I’ve got to get back and warn everyone... But... I do wonder if Grandmother is all right.

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: Yeah. I tried to fight those monsters. And you know what? I killed four of ’em! With my magic! That’s pretty good, huh?

recruit-visit.speaker: Tethys
recruit-visit.line: What am I going to do with you? Anyway, it’s not safe here. Come with me, Ewan.

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: ...... You-you don’t believe me... You watch and see. I’ll show you how far I’ve come!

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: Oh, Teacher! It’s you! You probably had to fight a ton of creatures to get here! You’re the best! I hope I can study with you forever.

recruit-visit.speaker: Saleh
recruit-visit.line: I’ve told you before... My mission is my life. If you wish to learn magic, you’d be better served by another.

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: No way. I wanna be just like you. Why would I go study somewhere else? Wait... You’ve gotta go out on a mission again, don’t you! Take me with you! I’ve practiced a lot. I can already use all the magic you taught me!

recruit-visit.speaker: Saleh
recruit-visit.line: ...... Well, you seem quite adamant. All right. You may accompany me. I think being with me might be safer than remaining on your own.

recruit-visit.speaker: Eirika
recruit-visit.line: Ewan! How wonderful. So you’re safe, are you?

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: Yep. I took care of a whole mess of those things. More of ‘em might show up at any time, so I’ll just follow you to the village. That’s all right, isn’t it?

recruit-visit.speaker: Eirika
recruit-visit.line: I guess so... It’s probably safer than leaving you here by yourself. Let’s stick together, Ewan.

recruit-visit.speaker: Ewan
recruit-visit.line: You were one of the people with my teacher, weren’t you? You think I can fight at your side? I can use the magic my teacher taught me. Well, what do you say?

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: I can’t believe monsters have appeared here in the realm of the Great Dragon. What is this world coming to? This staff you help to protect you against the beasts. Please travel safely.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Saleh? Is that you, Saleh? Tell me, is the Great Dragon well?

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: I’m sorry, Elder. I searched to the west, but I found nothing.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Is that so... Hm? Who’s that with you?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: I am Innes, prince of Frelia. The circumstances of our journey have led us here. We would like to pass through.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Please.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Hmmm... We of Caer Pelyn have turned away from the world outside. The Great Dragon alone holds all our honor and esteem. In this place, princes and pauper are equals. Do you have a problem with that?

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: ...No. I understand.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Hm... Well then, be welcomed as guests in our homes. I see some of you are injured. You should use this rock moss. We have little beyond what we need, but we will prepare food and bedding. You can rest as long as you like.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: We’ve no wish to trouble you. We’d just as soon pass straight through.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Don’t let your pride drive you to foolishness. That girl there looks like she’s ready to collapse at any moment. She’s ill from the height of the mountain. Saleh, prepare some tea for the lass.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Thank you, Elder...

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Call me Grandmother, child. That is what the villages call me.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Uh... Grandmother, may I ask you a question? This Great Dragon...

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Ah, the inquisitiveness of youth. Come, lass, listen to my words. The Great Dragon is...a blessing, one that watches over all mankind. Why, in days long past, when the Demon King appeared...

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Demon King? Are you speaking of the legend of the Sacred Stones? The hero Grado used the power of the five Sacred Stones to defeat and seal away–

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: No, no, that’s not right at all. Ah, how quickly did mankind forget its debt to the Great Dragon. To hear the story now, one would think humans alone brought about victory. That is a gross mistelling of the tale. Only through the Great Dragon’s strength could the Demon King be sealed away!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: The Great Dragon and the Demon King...

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Mankind may have forgotten its debt, but the Great Dragon never forgets. It watches over the bones of the Demon King in Darkling Woods. It keeps the Demon King’s dark brood from swarming the world of men. The Great Dragon’s vigilance alone has kept us safe from their blind rage.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Is that so? I’m... I’m sorry, I never knew...

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Hmph. You don’t need to know everything, but you should remember that.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yet, Grandmother, we encountered those creatures on the way here. And they have begun to appear in the land we live in as well. What does this mean?

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Ah... You have seen the effects of the omen that has appeared in the south. There is an energy there that has fouled the air and darkened the sky. The Great Dragon left Darkling Woods and went south to investigate. We of the village wished to protect the Great Dragon, so I sent my grandson, Saleh, as long as well. But they became embroiled in battle, and the Great Dragon disappeared. Since that time, there’s been no sign of the Great Dragon either here or abroad. We grew worried and directed Saleh to look for any trace of the Great Dragon. I am worried that the source of that foul energy may be responsible.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: A foul energy... From the south? Myrrh said something similar to this, too. Is the Great Dragon you speak of...one of the Manakete?

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Manakete?!? How dare you speak so of the Great Dragon!

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: I-I’m sorry.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: But if you’ve seen the noble Myrrh, perhaps I can proceed more quickly. You see, our Great Dragon took the form of Mistress Myrrh in her travels. And you tell me that you have seen the Great Dragon yourself, lass?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Yes. Myrrh was with my brother.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: What?! Where is this brother of yours!?

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: He leads a force of men against Grado. Myrrh rides beside him.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Saleh, this is urgent! You must leave for Grado at once and rescue the Great Dragon!

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Understood. I will...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Oh, where are you off to? If you’re going to Grado, the swiftest route takes you through Jehanna. It would be to your advantage to join us in our journey for a time. It’s far safer then being on your own.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: You have a point... Mistress Eirika, protecting the Great Dragon is my duty. Please allow me to travel with you on the road ahead.

end.speaker: Innes
end.line: We are in your debt, Matron.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: Not at all. All of our guidance comes from the Great Dragon. Saleh.

end.speaker: Saleh
end.line: Yes, I know. The road to Jehanna lies here.

end.speaker: Eirika
end.line: Grandmother, thank you so much for everything.

end.speaker: Grandmother
end.line: I know you’ll help the Great Dragon, but please look after Saleh as well. He’s not very personable, but he’s the only grandchild I have.
